org.magnos.stat
Class StatGroup

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.stat.StatGroup

public class StatGroup
extends java.lang.Object

A StatGroup represents a directory in the filesystem where its databases and child groups are stored. The databases and child groups are synchronized separately but can be synchronized together to perform certain operations. Most methods can have a target specified to determine precisely what groups the invokation will be applied to. If no target is specified the group has a default target (which is initially StatTarget.This). When databases are created in a group and a format is not specified the default format of the group will be used.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer
See Also:
StatTarget

Constructor Detail

StatGroup

public StatGroup(java.lang.String name)
Instantiates a new StatGroup in the current working directory. If a directory with the given name does not exist in the parent directory it will be created instantly.

Parameters:
name - The name of the directory in the current working directory.

StatGroup

public StatGroup(java.lang.String name,
                 StatGroup parent)
Instantiates a new StatGroup given the parent group and the name of this group within the parent. This will not automatically add this group to its parent, that must be done explicitly (or just use parent.getChild(name)). If a directory with the given name does not exist in the parent directory it will be created instantly.

Parameters:
name - The name of the group (directory) in the parent group (directory).
parent - The parent group (directory) to this group.

StatGroup

public StatGroup(java.lang.String name,
                 java.io.File root)
Instantiates a new StatGroup given its parent directory and its own directory. If a directory with the given name does not exist in the parent directory it will be created instantly.

Parameters:
name - The name of the group (directory) in the parent directory.
root - The parent directory.

Returns:
The reference to this groups StoreFactory.

Parameters:

get

public StatDatabase get(java.lang.String name)
Returns the database in this group with the given name. The name given can be a complete path (if the database persists to the filesystem) or the name provided when the group was added to the group (its filename without a path).

Parameters:
name - The name of the database to get.
Returns:
The database with the given name or null if one could not be found.

add

public StatDatabase add(StatDatabase database)
Adds the given database to this group. The database should not already exist in another group, unexpexted results may occur.

Parameters:
database - The database to add to this group.
Returns:
The previous database in the group with the same name. This typically should be null.

take

public StatDatabase take(java.lang.String name)
Takes a database from this group with the given name. If it doesn't exist in the group already it will be created with the default format. If the database with the given name is not valid null may be returned. The name given can be a complete path (if the database persists to the filesystem) or the name provided when the group was added to the group (its filename without a path).

Parameters:
name - The name of the database to get.
Returns:
The reference to the database in this group with the given name.

take

public StatDatabase take(java.lang.String name,
                         StatFormat format)
Takes a database from this group with the given name and format. If it doesn't exist in the group already it will be created with the given format. If the database with the given name is not valid null may be returned. The name given can be a complete path (if the database persists to the filesystem) or the name provided when the group was added to the group (its filename without a path).

Parameters:
name - The name of the database to get.
format - The format of the database.
Returns:
The reference to the database in this group with the given name.

remove

public StatDatabase remove(StatDatabase database)
Removes the given database from this group. If a database exists with the same exact name it will be removed whether it is exactly the given database or not.

Parameters:
database - The database to remove from this group.
Returns:
The database removed from this group, or null if none was removed.

remove

public StatDatabase remove(java.lang.String name)
Removes the database from this group with the given name. The name given can be a complete path (if the database persists to the filesystem) or the name provided when the group was added to the group (its filename without a path).

Parameters:
name - The name of the database to remove.
Returns:
The database removed from this group, or null if none was removed.

getChild

public StatGroup getChild(java.lang.String name)
Returns the child group of this group with the given name. If none exist one will be created (and its subsequent directory if it doesn't exist already). The store factory and all defaults will be applied to the child if one had to be created.

Parameters:
name - The name of the child to return.
Returns:
The reference to the child group.

load

public java.util.Set<StatDatabase> load()
Loads all databases in this group from its directory. If any of the databases in the group have not been previously loaded the default format of this group will used. This method will use the default target to determine precisely what groups this invokation will be applied to.

Returns:
The set of databases loaded in this group.

delete

public java.util.Set<StatDatabase> delete()
Permanently deletes all databases in this group and if possible the group itself (if it has no subfolders that have not been deleted). This method will use the default target to determine precisely what groups this invokation will be applied to.

Returns:
The set of deleted databases.

Parameters:
